qas.question: What state House bill would change Oklahoma's motto to 'Oklahoma - In God We Trust'?
What was Oklahoma's state motto, before the state House bill might change it?
Why did the state House think they could change Oklahoma's motto?

context: State law codifies Oklahoma's state emblems and honorary positions; the Oklahoma Senate or House of Representatives may adopt resolutions designating others for special events and to benefit organizations. Currently the State Senate is waiting to vote on a change to the state's motto. The House passed <a0_0>HCR 1024<a0_0/>, which will change the state motto from "<a1_0>Labor Omnia Vincit<a1_0/>" to "Oklahoma-In God We Trust!" The author of the resolution stated that a constituent researched the Oklahoma Constitution and found <a2_0>no "official" vote regarding "Labor Omnia Vincit"<a2_0/>, therefore opening the door for an entirely new motto.
